comment.text: The translation key "RenewSubscription" is used to display a message prompting the user to renew their subscription to a specific plan ("{{planName}} plan") in the PortalSettings page.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses lowercase 'plan' while the English uses title case 'Plan'.

The translation 'Abonnement des {{planName}}-Plans erneuern' is not the most natural or idiomatic way to say 'Renew subscription to {{planName}} plan' in German. 'Des' is grammatically correct, but sounds a little stiff. A more fluent translation would use a different preposition or phrasing.

The translation 'Uusi tilaus {{planName}} ohjelmaan' is not the most natural or accurate translation of 'Renew subscription to {{planName}} plan'. 'Uusi tilaus' literally means 'new subscription' which isn't quite the meaning of 'renew'.

While "{{planName}} 요금제 구독 갱신" is understandable, a more natural and precise translation of "Renew subscription to {{planName}} plan" would be "{{planName}} 플랜 구독 갱신" or "{{planName}} 요금제 구독 자동 갱신". 요금제 and 구독 갱신 are a bit too literal and stiff.
The word 'ຕໍ່ອາຍຸ' (tor ayu) is a correct term for 'renew' in this context. No spelling error found.
The word 'ການສະໝັກໃຊ້' (kan samak chai) is a correct term for 'subscription' in this context. No spelling error found.
The word 'ແຜນການ' (phaen kan) is a correct term for 'plan' in this context. No spelling error found.
The sentence structure is generally correct for Lao and accurately conveys the meaning of the English phrase.
The template variable {{planName}} is correctly included in the Lao translation.
The Lao translation is generally accurate and conveys the same meaning as the English original.
The translation appears to be formatted correctly for display within the application.
The translation is culturally appropriate for a Lao-speaking audience.

The word "subscrição" is generally used in European Portuguese. Brazilian Portuguese would use "assinatura". While understandable, using 'assinatura' would be more aligned with a broader Portuguese-speaking audience.

The word 'тариф' (tarif) is a closer translation of 'plan' as in pricing tier or subscription level, rather than the broader 'plan' which could also refer to a broader plan or service. 'Продлить подписку на {{planName}}' is generally correct, but 'тариф' might be more precise depending on context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Продлить подписку на {{planName}} план' if 'plan' is meant to be a broader term, or keep 'тариф' for more specific subscription tier.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "{{planName}} සැලසුමට දායකත්‍වය අළුත් කරන්න" is a literal translation of 'Renew subscription'.  A more natural and idiomatic way to express this in Sinhala would be to use a phrasing that indicates 'continue' or 'extend' the subscription. 'දාවත්වය යාවත්කරණය කරන්න' or 'ගිණුම දිගු කරන්න' would be better options.

The word 'අළුත්' can also mean 'new' in certain contexts. While not inherently wrong, in this context, 'දිගු' (long/extend) is a better fit for 'renew' and conveys the intended meaning of subscription continuation more accurately.
The Serbian translation uses 'Обновите' which translates to 'Update' rather than 'Renew'. 'Renew' implies continuing an existing subscription.
The word 'Обновите' is misspelled. It should be 'Наставите'.

The translation 'Obnovite pretplatu na plan {{planName}}' isn't the most natural way to say 'Renew subscription to {{planName}} plan' in Serbian. A more idiomatic translation would be 'Produžite pretplatu na plan {{planName}}' or 'Aktivirajte obnovu pretplate za plan {{planName}}'.
While "Gia hạn" generally translates to 'renew', in the context of subscriptions, "Mở rộng" or "Kéo dài" might be more natural and idiomatic.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Gia hạn or Mở rộng gói dịch vụ {{planName}}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation '将订阅更新至{{planName}}版本' doesn't accurately convey the meaning of 'Renew subscription to {{planName}} plan'.  '更新' (update) implies a change to an existing subscription, while 'renew' suggests extending the subscription's validity.  '版本' (version) is also an odd choice for 'plan'.
